abstract: The Federal Reserve laid out rules on Monday for banks seeking to repay taxpayer bailout funds, as two financial companies — JPMorgan Chase and American Express — said that they planned to tap the equity markets to do just that.
snippet: The Federal Reserve laid out rules on Monday for banks seeking to repay taxpayer bailout funds, as two financial companies — JPMorgan Chase and American Express — said that they planned to tap the equity markets to do just that.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve laid out rules on Monday for banks seeking to repay taxpayer bailout funds, as two financial companies — JPMorgan Chase and American Express — said that they planned to tap the equity markets to do just that.

headline.main: Fed Sets Rules for Banks to Repay Bailout Money
